meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a cudgel.
meanings.sent1: He cudgeled the tree to knock down the ripe fruits.
meanings.sent2: The thief cudgeled the door to break it open.
meanings.sent3: The chef cudgeled the dough to make it soft and pliable.
meanings.sent4: The waves cudgeled the shore relentlessly during the storm.
meanings.sent5: She cudgeled the pillow to fluff it up before going to bed.

meanings.definition: To use a cudgel as a weapon.
meanings.sent1: The knight cudgeled his opponent in the duel.
meanings.sent2: The bandit cudgeled his victims to steal their belongings.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully cudgeled each other with foam swords.
meanings.sent4: The boxer cudgeled his way to victory in the ring.
meanings.sent5: The warrior cudgeled the enemy soldiers to defend his kingdom.
